title: How to Check Your Iqama Status

steps.title: Get your Iqama.
steps.content: Get your Iqama. The Iqama ID is a white card with yellowish hologram imprints. It contains your ID picture with words “Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Ministry of Interior” and “Residence Permit” printed on it.

steps.title: Find your Iqama number.
steps.content: Find your Iqama number. Your Iqama number is a 10-digit numerical combination found at the bottom center section on the front face of the residence card or sometimes below your picture.

steps.title: Visit KSA’s Ministry of Interior website.
steps.content: Visit KSA’s Ministry of Interior website. Once you’ve identified your Iqama number, open a web browser on your computer and visit the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of Interior website at https://www.moi.gov.sa/wps/vanityurl/en/home .

steps.title: Change the language.
steps.content: Change the language. Select “English” on the top left hand of the to change its language to English.

steps.title: Access the site’s online services.
steps.content: Access the site’s online services. Click on “E-Services” from the menu tabs at the top of the MOI’s site home page to view the various online services offered by the Ministry.

steps.title: View the online Iqama status service.
steps.content: View the online Iqama status service. Select “Passport” from the left menu panel and choose “Query Iqama Expiry Service” from the sub-list.

steps.title: Check your Iqama validity.
steps.content: Check your Iqama validity. Enter your Iqama number and the randomly generated image code you’ll see on the page (for security verification) on the allocated text fields and click the “View” button. Your Iqama’s validity status will be displayed on the same page.
